summary: The Burj Khalifa, originally called Burj Dubai, is the tallest building in the world, located in the United Arab Emirates. It stands at 829.8 meters (over half a mile) tall and was completed in 2009. The skyscraper was renamed after Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, the former UAE president, who provided financial support during its construction. The design is inspired by Islamic architecture and features a Y-shaped floor plan optimized for residential and hotel use. It has 57 elevators and 8 escalators.
title: Burj Khalifa
